description: 1980 Volvo 264 GLE  Here is a rare Volvo 264GLE with the PRV engine.

It has the 2.7L PRV engine in it which is a collaboration motor that Peugeot, Renault, and Volvo all went in on. It is a powerful motor and was only put in certain car. Then you add the fact that this car is a 5-Speed Manual with Overdrive which was a rare option and this car is sweet. This is a rare car that you don't see many of. This is a 1 Owner Car and has low miles at 113K Original. This car spent most of it's life in Europe and was a Special Ordered Diplomat Car. The previous owner kept all the manuals and even filled out all the mileage and locations. He even had all the service manuals for the car which is very cool but these do not go with the car. You can tell he really cared for this car. The car is very fun to drive and just cruises down the road. Under the hood and undercarriage are clean and dry as can be. Make sure to watch the video I do a complete walk around of the car inside and out and even take it on a test drive.
This is a 1 Owner Car

The exterior of this car is beautiful. It is silver in color and has a very nice shine to it. It is starting to fade on the top surfaces but nothing major and the car still looks great.  All of the chrome and trim are very nice and clean on the car and the chrome just shines in the sun. This car is straight as can be and you can tell it was definitely cared for over the years. It has a very nice set of Aftermarket Factory 15" Volvo Wheels on it which I'm not sure if came on the car or were added afterwards. Either way the look great.

It has a very nice set of Pirelli Tires that are fairly new and I would say have about 90% tread left. These are very nice tires that have a lot of miles left on them and even still have the titties on the side.
Options:
5-Speed Manual Transmission w/ Overdrive
2.7L PRV Engine
Power Windows
Factory A/C
Sunroof
Leather
Aftermarket Pioneer CD Player

The interior is very clean on this car. It has the black leather interior that goes very well with the exterior. It has the real leather seats that are in very good condition and just need some conditioning. The front seats look great and there is just a couple small cracks on the seams of the drivers seat. These can be easily fixed. The back seats look great and don't look like they got sat in much. The carpets are in the same great condition. The previous owner kept all the manuals and records possible. It has a nice Aftermarket Pioneer CD Player installed in it as well. Make sure to watch the video I go through and show you everything.
This is just a beautiful car that is rare and you just don't see many like anymore. These cars are powerful and a blast to drive. Don't miss out on this one.

I took pictures of every detail of this car so you can get the full picture and know exactly what you are getting. If there is any other questions or any other pictures you would like please let us know.
Call anytime with questions…. Nathan 406-544-6919
Current Mileage: 113,273
Vehicle Disclosures of Condition:

Car has been sitting in storage for a couple of years ans will need misc stuff to make it run and drive. Fuel pump and not sure what else. Paint faded on top surfaces. Minor chips and dings on exterior. Couple cracks on seams of drivers seat. The green service manuals do not come with the car.  this is a classic car that is in need of some restoration. Everything is pictured and in the video.

description: 1980 Volvo 245DL 2-Door Sedan Wagon It shifts very smoothly tracks nicely and is fun to drive. It has lots of cargo space for groceries and even the extra 3rd seat to provide seating for up to 7. (My kids think it's fun to ride there.) Here is the work we have done Replaced the Gas tank and Fuel Line to Engine Fuel pump Replaced new headlight switch New alternator New battery in 2014 New exhaust in 2016. It has AC added by its original owner but it presently doesn't work. We haven't looked into what is wrong with it. When our mechanic replaced the fuel pump he converted it to that of a 1997 Bonneville. It is cold-blooded so you must give it a couple of minutes with your foot on the gas to warm it up. I suspect that a mechanic familiar with this Volvo engine could tweak the fuel mixture to help it out. The glass is all in very good condition as is the interior. (It was re-upholstered in 2014.) Apparently the previous owner replaced the dash with that of a GT. The odometer reads 38000 but I suspect that it may not be accurate though it was sold to me as accurate. It must be noted that this is an old car (in car years) and as such it will continue to need things restored. I am hoping that someone who loves the classic Volvo automobiles will adopt this very special example of one and continue its restoration.Vehicle is located in Richmond MO. Financing Nationwide Shipping and Warranties available to qualified buyers.
title: 1980 Volvo 245DL

description: In the autumn of 1971, a new version of Volvo's famous 1800 model was presented. The new version was called the 1800ES. The 1800ES had a newly designed rear end compared with the previous versions of the 1800. The roofline had been extended and the car had a profile that was more reminiscent of an estate. The 1800ES had increased luggage capacity to provide extra space for golfing or hunting equipment, for example.

Mechanically, the ES was identical to the E it replaced, including the B20 engine, a 1986 cc Bosch fuel-injected straight-four that made 135 horsepower. Overall, the ES was very well received, especially in the important US market, where journalists praised the car’s practicality and loved the elegant rear glass and clever hatch. Volvo cleverly advertised it as “sort of a flying trunk”, and from 1972 it was the only body style offered for their gorgeous 1800. 8,078 P1800ES’s were built and, just like the coupe versions, they make fantastic vintage automobiles that are rugged and reliable in addition to being fun to drive and great to look at.
New shocks all around and new exhaust system have been added.
Production of the 1800ES ended in 1973, mainly due to the increasingly rigorous safety requirements in the USA, which would have been too expensive to comply with.
This 81,000-mile example has been meticulously maintained. The interior is original without flaws. The body is very straight with never any damage or bodywork. The chrome is excellent as well.
title: 1973 Volvo 1800

description: 1973 Volvo 1800 ES Wagon - Utah Showroom  While the P1800 was more of a stylish touring car rather than a sports car when it came to its speed capabilities, the P1800 first became popular when it was featured as the main car driven by Roger Moore in the hit television series The Saint which aired from 1962-1969. The P1800 featured styling by Pietro Frua and mechanicals derived from Volvo's Amazon/122 series.  The ES's rear backrest folded down to create a long flat loading area. As an alternative to the usual four-speed plus overdrive manual transmission, a Borg-Warner three-speed automatic was available in the 1800ES. With stricter American safety and emissions standards looming for 1974, Volvo did not see fit to spend the considerable amount that would be necessary to redesign the small-volume 1800 ES. Only 8,077 examples of the ES were built in its two model years.  This Volvo is an iconic cult vehicle that is very clean ard to find. It is very well presented and features the Borg Warner 3 speed automatic transmission.
title: 1973 Volvo 1800 ES Wagon

description: Worldwide Vintage Autos is pleased to present this 1972 Volvo P1800. We scour the country for vintage cars and trucks and we rarely come across one like this! You must see and drive this rare Volvo!  HISTORY  The Volvo P1800 is a two-passenger, front-engine, rear-drive sports car manufactured and marketed by Volvo Cars as a coupe (1961-73) and shooting-brake (1972-73).  While the P1800 was more of a stylish touring car rather than a sports carwhen it came to its speed capabilities, the P1800 first became popular when it was featured as the main car driven by Roger Moore in the hit television series The Saint which aired from 1962-1969. The P1800 featured styling by Pietro Frua and mechanicals derived from Volvo's Amazon/122 series.  The car was marketed as the Volvo P1800, 1800S, 1800E and 1800ES. DISCLOSURE  -There are a few chips / imperfections in the paint and body. (See detailed pictures)  -Radio removed from dash. (See detailed picture)    Own this vintage 1972 Volvo P1800 at wholesale cost. The cost of parts and restoration of these vehicles are increasing daily. They are not making any more and, therefore, they are becoming more rare by the day. Buy one complete and ensure your investment for the future. Don't do the work yourself, get one finished for roughly half of the cost of building it yourself!   An excellent investment and something you can enjoy daily. Collectible vintage vehicles have historically appreciated at a rate greater than that stock market, gold and other arts and collectibles as documented by many articles and auction result tracking. description: Gr Auto Gallery is pleased to offer this 1973 Volvo P1800ES 2 door station wagon for consideration. The P1800, on the market for 10 years now as a 2 door coupe, gained massive popularity as a sporty and extremely reliable car that was visually pleasing. In 1972 Volvo introduced the ES version as a wagon so to gain traction in the utility and wagon market. The car carried the same most excellent look as the P1800 couple, same rock solid mechanicals and same sporty feel, but gave the car more passenger and cargo room. The P1800 is known for its longevity with an example still on the road surpassing 3 million miles in September 2013.

The 1973 Volvo P1800 ES offered here is a highly original example showing just 102428 miles on the odometer. The car has received one repaint in its original Ocean Blue Metallic. The car is powered by its B20F fuel injected engine, 4 speed manual transmission with overdrive and rear wheel drive. The car features a very tidy interior, featuring an excellent dash, seats and carpeting. Other highlights original working gauges, original trim and bumpers, original glass, upgraded wheels, Kenwood sound system, and excellent mechanicals.  The car comes to us from California and has had 3 owners prior to our recent acquisition and is a proven driver.

The Volvo P1800 ES has recently fallen in favor of car enthusiasts around the globe. Known as the Adventurer, their reliability, design and utility make them easy cars to own, drive and enjoy. The ES was only available for two years and for this reason, the cars remain quite rare and quality examples are few and far between. It is no secret that the vintage European car market is on fire and the Volvo P1800 ES wagons are rapidly increasing in value with values surpassing 40,000 dollars plus. A tidy example as the car offered here is sure to bring enjoyment and investment at the price offered here.
To see over 80 photos of this car, including under carriage please visit our website www.grautogallery.com
title: 1973 Volvo P1800 ES

description: Look what came from California to Michigan. This 1974 VOLVO 164e has only 18740 ACTUAL MILES.   Absolutely no rust and in gorgeous condition, this Volvo has been driven on several long trips and it is ready to go anywhere. The fuel injected engine runs strong, uses no oil, runs cool and has no issues.  The 3 speed automatic is smooth and it works exactly as it should. We received this Volvo after it had been in long storage, so we resolved any issues and drove it all over to make sure we had awoken this beauty from it's long sleep. Original paint, original interior, new tires, new brake hoses, rebuilt brake hydraulics, and an effective AIR CONDITIONING SYSTEM add the intrigue of this exceptional 43 year old Volvo. The sun roof does not open, but everything else, right down to the clock functions like it should.
title: 1974 Volvo 164e

description: For sale in our Houston showroom is a sharp and sporty 1972 Volvo P1800. When's the last time you saw one of these Swedish sports car rolling around at the local show? With smooth and sexy lines, this '72 Volvo for sale is one lovely looking European cruiser. Powering this little Volvo is a 1800 cc inline 4-cylinder engine fitted from the factory with dual carburetors. Opening up the engine bay, the side mounted carbs are truly a sight to see, encouraging others to gather around and stare. Backing the 4-cylinder is a 4-speed manual transmission with overdrive. A fun revving 4-cylinder euro sports car with a stick shift transmission, does it get any better than this? The exterior is borderline exotic, due to a couple of custom pieces that really make this Volvo pop! Adorned in a lovely shade of Red, this P1800 almost has a Ferrari type appeal. Staring at the front of this P1800 for sale, you're taken back by the custom hood scoop, which also gives this Volvo a dash of British appearing flair. The smooth lines work their way to the rear, becoming sharp and abrupt, trickling off out back like a cascading waterfall. With just enough chrome and polished trim to add some class to this ride, this Volvo is the best of both worlds. The class and luxury factor is continued throughout the cab. The Tan vinyl interior is clean and smooth, covering the front bucket seats, which just beg to be sat in. With  shifter jutting back just begging to be shifted, it's hard not to want to drive this P1800. Options on this Volvo P1800 for sale, include: A/C, AM/FM radio with Bluetooth, power brakes, seat belts, vinyl interior, and aluminum/alloy wheels wrapped in radial tires. Now's your chance to get into one cool and custom Swedish collector car! To see more HD pictures and video please visit GatewayClassicCars.com. For more information please call the Houston showroom at 832-243-6220 or e-mail us at Houston@GatewayClassicCars.com.
title: 1971 Volvo 1800

description: 1969 Volvo P1800S

The Volvo P1800 is a two passenger front engine, rear driven sports car manufactured and marketed by Volvo Cars as a coupe (1961-73). While the P1800 was more of a stylish touring car rather than a sports car when it came to its speed capabilities, the P1800 became popular when it was featured as the main car driven by Roger Moore in the hit television series The Saint which aired from 1962-1969. The P1800 featured styling by Pietro Frua and mechanicals derived from Volvo’s Amazon/122 series. The car was marketed as the P1800S,1800E and 1800ES. In 1998, an 1800S was certified as the highest mileage private vehicle driven by the original owner in non-commercial service — having exceeded three million miles (over 4.8 million KM) as of 2013.

Finished in stunning aqua blue with saddle interior, this magnificent southern estate example has been enjoyed by 2 proud owners from new. Latest owner since 1973, and has been meticulously maintained to the highest standards. The car has been only traveled only 45,000 original documented miles since new. It comes with a multitude of options:

Displacement Ratio 9.5:1
Top Speed 120 mph
